summary:
The Security Council, 
Recalling its previous resolutions and statements on Somalia, 
Determines Al-Shabaab's attempts to undermine peace and security in Somalia and the region, including through terrorism, constitute a threat to international peace and security, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, 
1. Decides to renew the provisions set out in paragraphs 15 and 17 of resolution 2182 (2014), and expanded by paragraph 5 of resolution 2607 (2021) to cover IED components, as most recently renewed by paragraph 1 of resolution 2762 (2024), until 3 March 2025; 
2. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
